definitions.definition: a number expressing the central or typical value in a set of data, in particular the mode, median, or (most commonly) the mean, which is calculated by dividing the sum of the values in the set by their number.
examples: the housing prices there are twice the national average
synonyms: par "the price is above the national average"

definitions.definition: an amount, standard, level, or rate regarded as usual or ordinary.
examples: the month's snowfall is below average
synonyms: we get about two million visitors each year"

definitions.definition: the apportionment of financial liability resulting from loss of or damage to a ship or its cargo.
reduction in the amount payable under an insurance policy, e.g., in respect of partial loss.
constituting the result obtained by adding together several quantities and then dividing this total by the number of quantities.
examples: the average temperature in May was 64°F

definitions.definition: of the usual or ordinary standard, level, or quantity.
synonyms: regular; midsize "a woman of average height"

definitions.definition: having qualities that are seen as typical of a particular person or thing.
examples: the average teenager prefers comfort to high fashion
a very average director who made very average movies

definitions.definition: achieve or amount to as an average rate or amount over a period of time.
calculate or estimate the average of (figures or measurements).
examples: their earnings, averaged out over the month, were only $62 a week

definitions.definition: result in an even distribution; even out.
examples: it is reasonable to hope that the results will average out

definitions.definition: result in an average figure of.
examples: the cost should average out to about $6 per page
